title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp insists Tottenham will be no walkovers ahead of Anfield clash
text:
Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp has insisted he is anticipating a difficult encounter when his side take on an out-of-sorts Tottenham team this weekend.

Spurs are yet to taste victory in the Premier League this month and have suffered some embarrassing defeats, notably 7-2 against Bayern Munich and 3-0 at Brighton.

Mauricio Pochettino's men have won just three Premier League games all season and are currently dwindling outside the top six after Dele Alli's late strike rescued a point against Watford last time out.

Jurgen Klopp has insisted Tottenham will be no walkovers when they visit Anfield on Sunday

But Klopp believes that this is not a true reflection of Tottenham's real capabilities and expects them to return to their best form at Anfield on Sunday.

'In the end it is a football match between two really good teams,' he said on Friday.

'Their current situation will not make a massive difference.

'We will not be that confident that absolutely nothing can happen to us... I don't know how many points they have but they will not play like a team with the points tally they have.

Dele Alli scored a late goal to rescue a point for Tottenham against Watford last weekend

'They are a top side in the Premier League and they will be a top side the whole season in the Premier League. We have to respect that and play the best football we can play.'

Klopp could however be without Joel Matip for the visit of Tottenham with the defender considered an injury doubt.

Matip missed Liverpool's midweek Champions League win over Genk due to a recurrence of a knee problem and will require a final check before Sunday's match, although Klopp has no concerns over full-backs Trent Alexander-Arnold (illness) and Andy Robertson.

He added: 'We just rested Robertson after 60 minutes (against Genk). Trent looked fine and there is no setback. I don't know about Joel. Still a bit of time out.'
description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp insisted he is anticipating a difficult encounter when his side take on an out-of-sorts Tottenham team this weekend.
